newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: CRICKET-ATHERTON PINS HOPES ON TEST SERIES.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-ATHERTON PINS HOPES ON TEST SERIES.

text.p: England captain Mike Atherton insisted England's one-day defeat to Zimbabwe would make no difference to his side's preparations for the first test starting on Wednesday.
"I've said all along it's a different form of the game," said Atherton, attempting to limit the damage caused by his side's poor batting efforts.
"Zimbabwe are a well equipped one day side, but they are limited at test level. The bottom line is that we need our batsmen to get bigger scores".

Referring to England's record of three losses in four starts against the part-timers, he admitted: "They're a bit of a jinx for us. But there are two games left and I'm confident we can turn it round.
"It's very difficult to win a one-day international when you've only scored 150, but we bowled well and fielded witb a lot of imagination and skill.

"I fancied our chances all the way through, but in the end we had to use up too many overs from our main bowlers to be competitive at the end. I knew we would have to bowl them out to win and that's what we tried to do."

Atherton felt the pitch was difficult to score fluently on, but Zimbabwe player/coach Dave Houghton suggested the home side deserved more credit. "Their batsmen have been here long enough now to find their feet, but we field well and bowl a constricting line."
